thread.title: City business owner charged with food stamp fraud
thread.title_full: City business owner charged with food stamp fraud

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: City business owner charged with food stamp fraud
text:
A city business owner was charged with misuse of food stamps, a felony on Friday. Aimal Sultan, 41, of Penfield, allegedly exchanged Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits for cash. He is accused of engaging in $4,895.22 worth of fraudulent food stamp transactions at his S and M Mini Mart at 439 South Ave. over a two-year period.
Two other business owners, Nabil Saeed, 58, owner of Discount Food Market on Avenue D, and Kamalaldain Ahmed, 55, the owner of Hudson Best Mini Mart on Hudson Avenue, were charged as a result of the same investigation in July.
Saeed was accused of $16,596.80 in fraudulent transactions, and Ahmed was accused of $3,465.53 worth of fraudulent transactions.
Sultan was arraigned on Friday. Cases against Saeed and Ahmed, who are each facing the same felony charge as Sultan, are currently pending in court.
WCLEVELAND@Gannett.com
